adHeader: Piano, Bass, Percussion --- TOM SHAW TRIO --- Jazz, Vocals and More
adDetails: Greetings from TOM SHAW TRIO! We offer versatile accompaniment and/or entertainment for your next musical theatre production, cabaret performance, venue, public or private event. Perfect music - with or without vocals - for background ambience, dancing or foreground entertainment. Repertoire includes jazz, blues, Latin, standards, swing and much more. With decades of experience between them, TOM SHAW TRIO provides a unique level of commitment and professionalism to every project. Easy to work with, reliable and fun, TOM SHAW TRIO is three excellent musicians with great personalities and a truly tight and distinct sound. Also available individually or in combination with other instrumentation. Whatever your music needs might be, please consider TOM SHAW TRIO. Here are some sample performance videos: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=anZFWwn9I44 - "Last Call" (from the film, "Don't Know Me") http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gA8RxPndarU - dance music compilation video (at the Ritz-Carlton Nob Hill, San Francisco) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0mCTbuky6sQ - "Crazy She Calls Me" (music video) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ab4CMNA3XSk - "Love Me Or Leave Me" (at Martuni's, San Francisco) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bd2oE_a_wXc - "Black Coffee" (at Cafe du Nord, San Francisco) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X08peTlI_tE - "Agua de Beber" (music video) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xzCjHZhXvEs - "Well Alright, Okay, You Win", with Matthew Martin (at the Rrazz Room, San Francisco) For further information, references, rates, playlist, availability, performance schedule and additional audio or video files, please visit TOM SHAW TRIO at: http://TomShawTrio.com or on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/TomShawTrio or call Tom at show contact info. TOM SHAW TRIO is: Tom Shaw (piano/vocals) Tom Shaw has been a busy party, wedding, event, cabaret and musical theatre pianist in San Francisco and around the Bay Area since 1978. For detailed information, including audio, video, resume, song lists and more, please visit http://TomShawPiano.com. Roberta Drake (percussion) For the past thirty years, Roberta Drake has worked with a variety of performers at clubs, and theaters throughout the Bay Area. Her ability to create percussion charts for many different styles of music has made her a welcome addition to orchestras, trios, and pit bands for theatrical productions. Please visit http://raddrake.com. John Greitzer (bass) John Greitzer plays bass in a variety of settings, including big band jazz, small group work, and musical theater at venues around the Bay Area. He plays weekly with the Walnut Creek Civic Arts Jazz Band, including performances at annual events such as the Walnut Festival and the Art On The Main summer art festival in Walnut Creek, and a variety of East Bay fundraising events and awards dinners.
